newsitem.title: USA: EFTC agrees to merge with Circuit Test.
newsitem.headline: EFTC agrees to merge with Circuit Test.

text.p: EFTC Corp said Thursday it signed a merger pact to buy Circuit Test Inc Cos for 1.85 million EFTC shares, $19.5 million cash, the assumption of certain liabilities, and an earnout based on future earnings.
The acquisition of privately held Circuit Test needs stockholder approval and should close by October 30, it said.

"This transaction meets EFTC's acquisition goals of being immediately accretive to shareholders and generating an internal rate of return greater than 20 percent," EFTC's chief financial officer Stu Fuhlendorf said in a press releease.
EFTC said it will continue to operate the CTI companies under their current brand names and will retain CTI's management in their present capacities.

"The merger will allow EFTC to offer cradle to grave services, expand its geographic breadth, and devise new innovative programs to help original equipment manufacturers reduce their inventory pipelines," company president and chief executive officer Jack Calderon said.
